description:
Tel Aviv, Israel

Job Type:

Part Time

About the Company
At Tectu, you can make a real impact! As a Data & BI Analyst you will play a lead role in delivering data and business strategies, solutions and processes to support the data oriented projects. The ideal candidate is passionate about delivering cutting edge solutions to support the changing business needs and technology landscape. You will be working closely with others on our Product and Engineering teams to define and deliver these solutions.
If you are data obsessed, passionate about technology, self-motivated and a disciplined freelancer, we would love to speak with you. The ideal candidate has both a willingness and desire to work in a dynamic environment, is able to apply Agile methodologies in day-to-day activities, and who enjoys working both independently with little oversight and in a team environment.
About the Role
At Tectu, we work with various customers, providing advanced tech solutions to solve different problems and needs. As a Data & BI analyst at Tectu, your day will most likely vary according to which projects you’re involved in, but generally you’ll be performing the following activities:
Identifying or diagnosing a problem to analyze
Collecting appropriate data from various sources
Cleaning and preparing the data for analysis
Analyzing the data for insights, patterns, or trends
Interpreting the results of the analysis with reports and dashboards
Collaborating with stakeholders and presenting key findings
Responsibilities:
Be an integral part of the team defining data strategy and capabilities roadmap for various customers
Work closely with data engineers to effectively plan and build data engineering tools, data warehouses and data lakes
Provide core contributions to multiple products, projects, solutions and processes through all stages of the development lifecycle
Perform analysis to assess quality and meaning of data
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets that could be helpful for the diagnosis and prediction
Use data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, Qlik) to build dashboards and drive insights
Analyze local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry
Prepare reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Qualifications
Requirements:
5+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst and Data Analyst
2+ years of experience in advanced analytic related multivariate and A/B testing, digital revenue attribution, cohort analysis, lifetime value analysis, media mix optimization, customer segmentation, and marketing effectiveness
3+ years of experience working with data visualization tools, such as Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, QlikSense, etc
Strong mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data
Strong analytical skills and SQL proficiency
Technical proficiency regarding database / DWH design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages to be used for data set analysis
Adept at using data processing platforms like Spark & Presto
Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions
Accuracy and attention to detail
Adept at queries, writing reports, and data visualization
Soft Skills:
Strong work ethic and strong core values (honesty, integrity, creativity)
Sense of urgency, ownership mindset, and customer focus
Innovative problem solver who takes initiative never stops thinking about ways to improve
Ability to self-learn new skills and technologies
Advantage:
BSc in highly-quantitative field (Analytics, Computer Science, Industrial Eng, Mathematics, EE) is preferred
Data driven mindset
Able to create and communicate the 'big picture' in a clear way.
Familiar with best practices of the data and software engineering lifecycle
Knowledge of programming languages like Python, R, MATLAB, or otherShow more Report

Job Description
We are looking for Supply chain technical analyst.
The New Product planner (NPP) ensure NPI samples are correctly forecasted, built to specifications, and delivered in the most timely manner to support internal & external customers’ CPU validation efforts.
As part of your job, you will be responsible to:
Coordination and startup activities for a product line from engineering to high volume manufacturing.
Collect and scrub engineering and/or marketing sample demand by product forecast.
Analyze risks, capacity utilization, inventory levels, engineering requirements and customer demand, and/or delivery expectations from product start-up through product stabilization.
Drive new product marketing and manufacturing naming and routing requirements through product planning systems setup activities.
Manage products in growing complex environment that introduce new supply chain challenges.
Interact and manage cross-functional stakeholders.
Understand both supply chain strategies and technical details of product engineering programs.
Drive root cause solutions and improvements based on thorough understanding of the business processes and supply chain dependencies.
Communicate, explain and clarify complex issues with the customer business groups and divisions.
Collaborate to develop processes and tools for new manufacturing flow and/or new product configurations.
Apply, analyze and interpret data to recommend optimized procedures and processes, identify areas of opportunity to further optimize Intel's supply chain from Wafer Starts through Assembly and Test.
Qualifications
Student to Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering, Business Administration or related field.
At least 3 semesters until graduation.
Analytical skills,.
Willingness to work in a diverse team environment.
Work well in an ambiguous environment.
Strong communication skills.
Attention to details, well organized, efficiency and quality oriented.
Ability to manage modular product (that includes several die elements such as : external die, internal die, GT, IO, etc.)
Ability to influence business Unit decision making.
Inside this Business Group
Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.

Posting Statement
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.

Benefits
We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here: https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/jobs/benefits.html

Working Model
This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.
JobType
HybridShow more Report

Powerlink is an end-to-end business management platform tailored for your business-specific needs.

From marketing to sales to customer service, and more, Powerlink makes it easy for your entire business to work together.
Each department is powerful on its own, but together they can be explosive.
Powerlink was built from the ground up by developers who already knew back in 2011 that there had to be a better way to improve customer relations and decided to develop a software for every need aimed to keep customers delighted.
After conquering the local market with more than 2000 satisfied Israeli customers from various industries, we are ready to go global.

Our Customer Success department includes:
Technical Support team - the first point of contact for customers.
Account managers team - developing long-term relationships with customers, building loyalty, and ensuring higher customer retention and satisfaction.
Technical product experts - sharing their extensive knowledge for designing solutions for strategic customers.
We are looking for a true leader who is passionate about people and technology to lead
the CS department through this adventure.
Are you up for the challenge?

The Role:
Powerlink's support team is dedicated to providing outstanding service to its customers by answering their needs.

Different issues are raised by customers through the website, email, chat, and contact form.

The support engineer registers the issue in our ticketing system, and a new ticket is generated.

A new ticket is routed to the appropriate rep and team (Support, CS, PS), and the rep has to take the necessary steps to resolve it.

Your Experience & Skills:
2nd or 3rd year student in Industrial Engineering/ Information systems/ Computer Science.
‍
Available to work 3 days a week.
‍
Independent worker and a team player.
‍
High learning capabilities, willing to dig in and explore.
‍
High service awareness.
Experience in working with customers - advantage.
Thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Strong attention to details.
Tech oriented with ability to learn new technologies quickly.
‍
Strong sense of ownership and responsibility.
Capable of training and supporting users throughout all system processes.
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
High English Level.
We Appreciate Those With:
Say what they think.
Independent and proactive in a fast-paced environment.
Fast learner.
Has excellent interpersonal and presentation skills.
Proven track record of building client relationships and being client facing.Show more Report

Quantum Machines is the global leader in control systems for quantum computing, providing the hardware and software tools researchers and businesses need in order to build quantum computers from the ground up. We are pushing the envelope in a field on the verge of exponential growth, bringing about opportunities like those made possible with the invention of classical computing 50 years ago.
We are assembling the strongest team of professionals in the world with the goal of revolutionizing how quantum computers are built and controlled, while accelerating their arrival. Come join a multi-disciplinary world-class team and work on a new class of problems at the cutting-edge of technology, science, and business.
Quantum Machines is backed by top tier investors such as Battery Ventures, Red Dot Capital Partners, TLV Partners, and Avigdor Willenz’ investment group.
We are looking for one physics student (BSc or MSc) with a passion for communication and for writing technical-marketing content. The ideal candidates have taken quantum mechanics courses and are eager to learn about the challenges of the scientific and industrial community around quantum computing and control. You will be guided in learning about the key players of today’s quantum ecosystem and keeping up to date with research and industry efforts.
Responsibilities:
Develop a deep understanding of the technology, ecosystem, customer challenges and industry trends, in order to create related content such as social media posts, white papers, web pages, brochures, presentation and more
Create sales tools as product brochures, case studies, product videos and product presentations
Produce and review technical notes and product marketing material for QM - a thriving international quantum control company.
Work closely with internal peers such as Product, R&D and CTO Teams to summarize into text that convey our value to customers in the best way.
Requirements:
Basic quantum mechanics university course (must)
Excellent writing skills (must)
Able to study independently and eager to learn
Advanced or technology-oriented quantum mechanics courses (plus)
Fluent in English (spoken and written) – Danish NOT required (plus)
Some experience with scientific and technical writing (plus)
Expecting 40%-60% as a part-time positionShow more Report

Job Description
 ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Preparing, instructing and grading of class coursework;
Assigning final grades.
QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Applicants must be compliance with Chapter 69A-37.058 Firefighters Standards and Training
Minimum of 6 years of experience as a regular member of an organized Fire department
A minimum of Fire Service Instructor I Certification
A minimum of Live Fire Training Instructor I Certification (within one year)
Applicant must have a letter of recommendation from a current Fire Academy Instructor who has a minimum of three (3) years of service at the IRSC Fire Academy
Applicant must have a letter of recommendation from his/her immediate supervisor
Applicant must submit a resume detailing his/her job and educational history
Applicant should also submit any additional documentation to support his/her qualifications as an instructor
SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Instructing in the Basic Recruit Firefighting Academy;
Serving as a liaison and resource to the fire service community and public school systems of the service district;
Serving on college committees as assigned, marketing the program; serving as an advisor to a vocational advisory committee; academic advisement to students;
Reviewing and revising curriculum to meet mandated changes or industry needs;
Appropriately integrating computer software and technology-based instruction;
Maintaining a safe and effective classroom environment;
Participating in department, division, and adjunct faculty meetings;
Performing other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
This position requires an ability to sit, stand, walk, bend, reach up, stoop ability to participate in physical activities related to firefighting, the ability to lift an object of fifty (50) pounds or less, and carry items in excess of fifty (50) pounds. It also requires manual dexterity to operate Firefighting equipment, standard office machines, such as, copier, fax, calculator, telephone, and other equipment as necessary. IRSC expects its employees to follow proper safety standards while employed by the College.
Classification
Adjunct
Supervisory
No
FLSA Exempt
No
Employment Type
Temporary (Fixed Term)
Compensation and Application Deadline
Commensurate with Degree/Experience Level | Adjunct positions at IRSC are filled on an as needed basis and are permanently posted. You will be contacted for an interview only if the related department has positions to fill.Show more Report

job: Customer Service Rep Part-time Position (No Sales, Work Remotely
description:
We are an established online business in Canada. We are seeking a responsible individual for phone and email support to fill a position that is opening due to the upcoming retirement of a team member.

The candidate must be comfortable with speaking to customers over the phone to address customer concerns and questions, and resolve issues regarding personal accounts.

The position requires work during Canadian business hours, 3-4 hours per day, 4-5 days per week.

The job does not require technical knowledge except for basic computer skills.

Job duties:

Respond to customers needing help understanding how to navigate the site.

Help answer customer questions, troubleshoot, and investigate customer inquiries to provide the best solution.

Compose thoughtful, personalized responses for a variety of customer requests via email and phone.

Provide customers with excellent customer service.

Work with other team members to provide and receive mutual support.

Our requirements:

English mother tongue-MUST

Good problem-solving/reasoning skills-MUST

Excellent verbal, written communication, and editing skills - MUST

Additional qualifications:

Customer service, retail, or marketing experience is an asset

Bilingualism (English/French) is preferred

Available to commit to work during Canadian business hours

Short weekend hours are available in addition to regular hours and are optional.
Important: Please indicate your desired salary.

Apply now: rachelca1975@gmail.comShow more Report

job: Part time Admin and finances for non-profit
description:
A small non-profit organization, that promotes and works for a united Jerusalem through tours, education, advocacy, and land reclamation, is looking for a fully bilingual secretary to work in admin, basic bookkeeping, and finances, marketing support and PA to the President
The position is part time, flexible hours in Ramot B office.
Essential requirements:
At least 3 years experience working in an office in admin and basic bookkeeping
Fluency in English and Hebrew (at least 10 years in Israel or grew up here)
Organized with attention to detail, works well with numbers and spreadsheets
Excellent command of Word, especially Excel, Internet, and E-mail , (quick-books an advantage) Please send your CV to chaim@keepjerusalem.orgShow more Report

Cardo Systems, the global market leader in the field of wireless communication systems for motorcycle & ski helmets, is looking for an Italian speaker Sales Operations Admin to join its sales department.
Part-time position (50%) in a hybrid model (from the company's offices at Raanana/from home), reporting directly to Sales Operation Manager and dotted line to the Country Manager in Italy.
Job Description:
In this role, you will join our sales team and become the focal point for Cardo’s channel partners in Italy. You will support sales leadership in enabling revenue growth and increasing sales productivity by providing effective assistance with the day-to-day administration of the sales team and front/back-office tasks.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Serving as the main focal point for the sales managers and customers regarding product availability, answering queries, reports, etc.
Act as an internal focal point for sales order-related issues, including order processing, modifications, shipments, etc.
Tracking the automated sales order system and providing backup when needed.
Maintaining & tracking sales data in Priority ERP/Salesforce CRM, including reports and sales analysis
Financial support: budget control, commission follow-up, collecting payments, and more.
Marketing support by booking Events/Locations.
Sell Thru reports
Requirements:

Requirements:
Our ideal candidate is goal-oriented with customer service experience. If you have exceptional organizational and communication skills and draw energy from being part of a team, we would like to meet you!
Good Italian language skills, written and oral - a must.
0-2 years of relevant professional experience (in sales or costumers support/ front/back-office or other); preferably from a global company with a technological environment.
Service-oriented personality with a can-do attitude.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Well organized, multi-tasking abilities, working well under pressure.
Quick perception and good self-learning ability.
Availability for 50% position.Show more Report

With the growing demand for traffic bandwidth in datacenters, efficient physical high-speed communication becomes a crucial part of the development of silicon ASC’s that serve networking infrastructures. We are looking for a PHY (Physical Layer) Architecture student for our Architecture team. We are positioning you to a key role to face this challenge and become part of our team, so we can continue developing the best devices in the industry.
NVIDIA's networking architecture group is seeking for a highly motivated, eager to learn and open minded student to explore, and define the Physical layer of our products. As a leading engineer, you'll be responsible to define and drive features and have responsibility on the Physical layer architecture. The role will include definition of both the hardware circuitry and the firmware/software that is involved in operating the physical layer communication. We are searching for hardworking, enthusiastic, student, which has both high grades as well as good personal skills, in order to be able to lead cross groups activities.
What you will be doing:
Lead projects across team, starting from processing requirements and definitions from customers and translating those into detailed technical specification for hardware architecture, system embedded software, user interface and high-level design.
Define the architecture of implementing physical layer standards into NVIDIA’s ASIC devices.
Involved in standard bodies activities and definition of next generation protocols.
Define features for the phy layer, to exploit interoperability between different generations of communication.
Be involved in product definition and the high-speed protocols that the NVIDIA networking devices will support.
Work closely with multi-functional teams - design, backend, system, marketing, firmware, driver, etc. Provide architecture definitions and as a result converge on key design decisions.
Become focal point for NVIDIA’s physical layer networking communication devices.
What we need to see:
B.Sc. student in Electrical Engineering.
Excellent problem solving, teamwork, and interpersonal skills.
Communication skills, analytical abilities, technically hands-on.
Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Experience in the following fields: Physical layer communication / System / Signal Integrity / high-speed communication protocols.
Experience in embedded software.Show more Report

Hello,

We are looking for a part-time assistant to help us with all of our back office logistics. They would be working directly with the owner as well as working with employees.

Duties Include Marketing, Customer Care, Scheduling, Research for potential clients, and maintenance of the back office.

Hebrew/ English a must. Minimum 2 yrs experience. Motivated and hardworking individuals only. Working from home with potential for office position as the company grows.

Rank Ranger, a leading SEO & digital marketing platform provider, is looking for a part-time marketing assistant to join its team.
We’re looking for a marketing assistant to help us expedite our marketing process. The marketing assistant will help support the CMO and the marketing team to better implement the company’s marketing strategy.
The position is perfect for anyone looking to get started in digital marketing.
Responsibilities:

Assist in the creation of marketing materials

Edit a variety of marketing content

Create social media posts as needed

Work to help support SEO and paid advertising campaigns

Support the customer service team as needed


Requirements:

High-level professional English

Strong writing & editing skills

Comfort working with technology

Quick learner

Team player


Email your CV and cover letter to jobs@rankranger.comShow more Report
